intro: Psychotria pancheri, commonly known as the Pancheri Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforest understories. Due to its unique appearance and potential chemical properties, it is of interest to botanists and ethnobotrists.
